physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 15.9 years, the patient was noted to have stunted growth, cold and dry skin, and a huge visible goiter. Normal thyroid function was present at birth.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's growth curve started to decline around age 7, crossing the 2.5th percentile by age 9.5. Thyroid ultrasound at age 24 showed a hypervascularized goiter, measuring approximately 235 ml for the right lobe and 224 ml for the left lobe.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Biological hypothyroidism with elevated TSH and free T4 serum levels. Thyroid ultrasound showed a multinodular goiter estimated at 59 ml each lobe initially, increasing to very large sizes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient was poorly compliant to L-T4 treatment and had only rare periods of normal thyroid function before being lost to follow-up between ages 17 and 21. When reassessed at age 24, severe signs of hypothyroidism were observed.
